website_summaries.verdict: Aside from a couple performance quibbles, the Canon PowerShot A1100 IS provides a good point-and-shoot experience with great pictures as a result.
pros: excellent photo quality for the money

customer_reviews.title: Would have been perfect for intended purpose but as I have seen in ...
customer_reviews.text: Would have been perfect for intended purpose but as I have seen in other reviews, this particular Canon camera apparently loses it's ability to auto focus especially when using the zoom. Fuzzy Wuzzy wasn't a bear but rather a Canon PS A1100is. I would have kept it had it had a manual zoom mode but it does not. A model that is destined to become history and that is where it should stay.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Van Patten

customer_reviews.title: The latest model is not always the best
customer_reviews.text: One of the benefits of shopping Amazon.com is the access to nearly new stock of items that were proven good in the past but are no longer available elsewhere. Certainly newer models are available, but this camera produces excellent photos with its automatic controls. It runs on easily obtainable "AA" cells and has a high quality viewing screen. This one was bought to replace one bought several years ago that was damaged. The seller "Best Buy" was extremely helpful when a shipping problem developed. I highly recommend this camera and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Willard

customer_reviews.title: 2 AA batteries is all you need.
customer_reviews.text: I stumbled on this model because it uses 2 AA batteries. I did not want to fool with a battery pack and having to charge it and worry about if it's charged when i'm ready to use it. I do recommend you get the SD card or whatever so you have more memory. It works great but has been discontinued and very hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer, and the images from this camera are terrific. It has some important auto-overrides, such as exposure +/- compensation, color/contrast adjustments, flash control, etc., that are usually missing on a point-and-shoot auto camera like these. Great feature is the AA battery rather than proprietary rechargable. On remote shoots where recharging is not possible, it is a great feature no longer available on most cameras. Controls are not as user-friendly as on my Canon 5D, but with use they are easier to master. A great little camera for vacations and situations where you need a large file size in a compact camera. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon A1100IS
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad camera, but it isn't the best for low light situations. Video quality is just OK, audio not good in loud situations. Only bought it at the last minute to take on a trip because my good camera went MIA...(Canon30XIS). Fine for travel and quick snap shots in good lighting conditions. It's small and very lightweight. Would be better if it had more zoom, but I've been spoiled. I love that it takes AA batteries though-hate it when I miss out on opportunities because my batteries died and I can't find/afford the specialized batteries (or have to wait til they charge up again).
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: It's a simple point and shoot and by no means a $500+ quality camera but it takes beautiful pictures and is simple
customer_reviews.text: Had this camera before (then it disappeared dang it) so had to get it again. It's a simple point and shoot and by no means a $500+ quality camera but it takes beautiful pictures and is simple, all that I require from a camera. I have a phone with a great camera but this is more user friendly for my needs (beekeeper). It can macro beautifully and gets the shots much better than my phone.
customer_reviews.author: KateS

customer_reviews.title: HAS COME TO THE RESCUE MANY TIMES
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as an extra. Whenever my Husband and I go to the zoo or sightseeing I always have him take photos just in case my DSLR doesn't capture the closeups the way I like. Well Hubby has gotten many gorgeous shots that I have missed. This little camera is amazing and I highly recommend it. Since it only has a 4x zoom it is not reliable for zoom shots but hey that's what the DSLR is for. You will love this little easy to carry camera.
customer_reviews.author: D. CAPONIGRO

customer_reviews.title: good basic camera
customer_reviews.text: I selected this camera to replace my older [and hard used] Canon power shot A530. I needed a camera that used easily obtained batteries--not the rechargable ones used by so many new cameras. I also wanted a view finder for the many situations when the screen was simply not visible. I did not want 'smile detectors' or touch screens. This camera seemed to be the only choice. It was a good choice and has met expectations. It is harder to hang onto than the old power shot which was nicely grippable. It seems to take marginally better pictures. All told--I am satisfied with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: F. Burton

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes fantastic pictures. The big thing I don't like is that there is no instruction book with it. The company says they're "going green" and you can download the book, but you have to print it off to have it in front of you when you need it so you are using paper--how green is that? Also, some things I found out the hard way is that the date & time do not show up on every setting and I didn't see that on the 30 pages or so I printed off. For me, the absolute amateur, I NEED A BOOK! I do like the camera-- it has an infinite variety of settings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera even thogh an older model
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera specifically to replace the exact model that got smashed while taking photos from a high ladder off the side of the hose. This model was always a durable and easily operated camera even though it doesh't have all the features and capacities of the newest models. This model is a very good camera.
customer_reviews.author: Djsservice

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera that I could just drop in my purse and go for those "Oh, I wish I had my camera" moments. This camera was an ideal answer. Picture quality is very, very good, and even though I have not used all the features (and there are many) on the camera, I'm sure that the rest will be up to par. My suggestion would be to take the time to read the manual (provided on disc) to learn all that your camera can do. But if you're like me and want to hurry up and "point and shoot", this camera works like a dream!
customer_reviews.author: Deanne Ross

customer_reviews.title: Tough camera and good photos
customer_reviews.text: I saw this camera was rated #1 for point and shoot image quality on some camera review sites. It also has quite a lot of flexibility in choosing how you want your photos shot. This is a great camera that I can carry when it's not convenient to have my big DSLR and lenses with me. I've dropped it several times and although it's a bit scratched up now, it still takes great photos and battey life is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent point-and-shoot camera.
customer_reviews.text: An excellent point-and-shoot camera. I like the AA battery and view finder, as well as the image stabilization. I routinely carry one of these in my pants pocket wherever I go.
customer_reviews.author: Edith in Alaska

customer_reviews.title: Great camera - great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he seems to like it very much. It's been over 5 years since we've bought a camera and like everything else, so much has changed! This camera seems much more intuitive in its use than our older digital camera. Picture quality seems very good. If I were to give anything a negative - it would be the little "door" where the battery/memory card goes. It's a little on the flimsy side and rather awkward to use. I think for the price it's a great deal and Amazon's quick shipping was appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: P. Koryn

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: These thinner bodies result in flimsier materials. The on/off button - it is difficult to distinguish whether or not you've pushed it. The battery/card door is also flimsy and very difficult to open and close. This particular camera quit working (and we can't figure out why) after only 7 months of use. Average use was once per week. This camera is/was used for work - we design roads and take pictures of cracks in the pavement, street signs, i.e., things that don't move. We are NOT hard or abusive of the equipment. Next camera will have a fatter body.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Summitt

customer_reviews.title: Great all-purpose camera
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our teenage son to chronicle his adventures without worrying if it got beat-up. He loves all its features and the pictures are better than the ones taken by our more expensive camera. It is easy to set up and use, small enough to fit into a pocket and has lots of different functions for different lighting and scenery. The only negative we have discovered so far is that it eats up batteries pretty quickly. On the plus side, it takes regular AA batteries which are easily found and replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Book Mom

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found this camera
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find this older Canon Powershot model, and I was so happy to find it on Amazon. Friends had it, and I liked the features and photo quality. However my main reason for buying it is that they no longer make digital cameras with view finders. A dark LCD in bright sunlight is very problematic for taking decent pictures. This is one of the last good ones. The Amazon re-seller was great. Description said "used", but it was indeed brand "new".
customer_reviews.author: P. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use camera.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after a lot of searching on different web sites. This site had the best deal with no shipping charge, at the time, which sold me! I am not an experienced photographer, so I needed something easy to use and to understand how it worked. With a little help from my daughter, I learned how to use this camera and it's functions. This was only the second digital camera I ever owned. I am impressed with Canon Powershot, since I owned a Kodak before this. It is easy to use and takes good pictures. I'm glad I made this choice. I would recommend this camera for your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alley Sally

customer_reviews.title: A Gift I Gave, Still Used to This Day......2011
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera after a great deal of research for a friend's Christmas gift. She is very techno challenged and we set it up together. She uses this camera to this very day and has taken 1000's!!!!! of photos without a single issue. She is tickled to death having this item and if she can use it well, anyone can. Her photos are excellent, the batteries seem to hold up well, very sturdy item. Buy this camera, espcially if you want a great point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA. After about a year of ownership, the battery/memory card cover latch refused to release. Out of desperation, I pried the cover open which damaged the hinge. I did manage to get the cover to re-close. However, the next time I choose to open it, it appears as though it will have to be pried apart again. Eventually I suspect that such forceful opening will damage the cover to the extent that it will be broken for good. UPDATE 10/1?13. My prediction came true. After after three years of ownership the cover latch failed completely. The camera is in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but...
customer_reviews.text: Yikes! I own three Canon digital cameras... this is the only one that gobbles batteries like they are candy. On a recent trip, I went though 4 sets in one day. Yes, I took a lot of pictures. but with the other Canons I have used, the AA batteries lasted most of the day before I had to change them. Pictures are great, but this power issue is a big disappointment. This will NOT be taken on any vacations... it will be a stay at home camera only.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R

customer_reviews.title: i will try a nikon or sony and see.
customer_reviews.text: was good for a while then it started having false low battery icon, a factor in many canon cameras apparently.
customer_reviews.author: michaelray

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as he wanted a digital camera with a viewer. Have to replace the batteries a little more often than i would like but he is very much satisfied with quality of the pictures and it does what he needs it do !! Have owned other Canons and have liked them all!!
customer_reviews.author: mets fan

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for on the go
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of Canon for awhile, I have the Rebel XSI, love it. I decided to purchase this camera for a simple reason I do not always want to cart around the BIG camera, and frankly it does not fit in my pocket. The operation of the camera is easy to use. Takes great pictures, and very easy to print directly to a printer or anywhere for that fact. Great Lil camera for on the run. Would recommend to my Mom.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cart

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as specified
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good camera. I dropped my and destroyed it and was saving for an advanced model so a new Canon 1100is was counter productive. The used one from Amazon is perfect. It works perfectly and the pictures are ideal... The seller shipped the camera promply and it arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. McGuckin

customer_reviews.title: great little point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: just got back from vacation and am very pleased with my photos. I picked this model specifically for the optical viewfinder in an "under $200" camera. And I'm so glad I did; there were many times when I wouldn't have been able to see what I was shooting using the LCD display due to the glare. Also, it uses 2AA batteries which are easy to carry/get extras of... I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: island lady

customer_reviews.title: Great Graduation Gift
customer_reviews.text: I am an unsophisticated camera user. I bought this camera for my grandson's 8th grade graduation and took pictures with it throughout the 2 1/2 hours of ceremonials and reception. I handed it to him with his class pics within at the end. It was easy to use and batteries were still going strong at the end with a lot of on/off switching during the evening. I have not seen the pictures out of camera yet.
customer_reviews.author: Boooooks

customer_reviews.title: so I love having a view finder built into the camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm old school, so I love having a view finder built into the camera. The camera takes great pictures, is very easy to use, and it is small enough to slip into any pocket for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: H. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten great high quality pictures of my 2 year old daughter, inside, outside, every expression with the "burst" which takes many pictures in a row. Batteries have been running out quickly, I've heard you should use expensive high quality batteries, the generic ones just don't cut it for camera use. So glad I bought this! And it really is the best deal on the market.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mays

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much for $150.00. I was pleasantly surprised when I started using the camera. It has more features then I'll ever use, but it's nice to know that they're available. The pictures I've taken, both indoor and outdoor, were very good. The video really surprised me and my family. I didn't buy it for the video, but it's so good, I bought a bigger memory card. I highly recommend it in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mark

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I have had prior Canon products and have always been impressed with their intrinsic value, whether copiers or cameras. This camera does not dissapoint. It's easy to use, has great picture quality and is priced right. This particular one was purchased for my sister-in-law who saw how happy we were with our previous purchase. She is very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph E. Armitage

customer_reviews.title: Camera didn't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought it used, but I expected it to last longer than it did. Canon is a great company that makes great cameras, but buyer beware! Buy a new camera, not a used one. Go to a retailer that will offer a warranty. I expected a longer life from this camera. It deteriorated quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not the best camera. Really buggy and lags. Shots don't come out clean.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Cannon Powershot A1100
customer_reviews.text: It's a great camera for the price. The picture quality is excellent and it is very easy to use. I keep it in my pocketbook all the time and the battery life is great. I use rechargeable double A's. The movie quality is also good for a small inexpensive digital camera. I upload short clips to a website to share with family and it is easy to do and so handy.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Brunton

customer_reviews.title: Good for bottom of the line model
customer_reviews.text: This is a good for the price. Startup is decent and the pictures can be taken. Nothing serious and the autofocus is slow but that's to be expected. This is for someone who wants to keep a small camera in their purse and take some snapshots that will be better than their camera phone.
customer_reviews.author: P N

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot A1100IS
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best small camera I have owned. Firstly the price was right, secondly the ease of use was of a great importance to my wife and I. I was getting so fed up with instruction booklets which were 220 pages long and about as easy to read as the magna carta. The picture quality is also very very good and I imagine that I will never stray away from canon products in the future. This item was a great find.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN Mcmullen

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot Camera
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera however, it is too complicate for me. Would be good for someone who is really into photography. I got a Kodak right after getting this one and it is so much easier, I just really point and shoot. Guess I should resell this one. It is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Bought for wife and would buy for self.
customer_reviews.text: I measure products in terms of bang for buck. This camera has incredible bang for buck. The cost is low, and the quality is high. The pictures are clear, crisp, and with excellent color and contrast. It is easy to use. It is light weight, but does not feel cheap. The zoom has improved a lot compared to older versions of these cameras. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Had this phone for many years and it still provides great pictures. Has the small chip to easy swap pictures to your computer. Eats up battery life so have a few extra double As on standby.
customer_reviews.author: Mully

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a wonderful Canon camera for a while now(Power Shot SX10IS) but it is big and bulky and not convenient to carry around with me, just in case i need it. I cannot tell you how many times i have said I WISH i had my camera with me....Well, i bought this little beauty and keep it in my handbag and have used it countless times. I am thrilled with the ease of use and the quality of the pictures it takes. I would definitely recommend this camera to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ellen Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Lousy sensor.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 6.1MP version of this camera, and was thrilled. The sensor on newer model, while having more megapixels, actually takes much worse pictures. I haven't found a setting yet, even at very low ISO's, that are not marred by grainy noise. This appears to be a classic example of a manufacturer cramming in more megapixels, but having worse picture quality. I like a camera that uses AA batteries, but I'd avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest Parker

customer_reviews.title: Low picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a PowerShot A520 and wanted to upgrade. Needless to say, I sent this camera back and went back to using my old camera. This camera left half of my pictures blury and grainy. I am used to using a Powershot and was really surprised when I saw how this one took pictures. The pictures were terrible. I took some more with my old camera and had them printed at the same time and the same place to make sure and it was this camera that did so poor. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Compact Travel Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little travel camera. I like that it has both a video screen and an eye-level viewer, which works so much better in bright sunlight. I also like that it uses replaceable AA batteries. As someone who has traveled all over the world, I know how frustrating it can be to have rechargeable batteries die just when great photo opportunities occur. AA batteries are available just about everywhere. It also uses the standard SD card. There's really no excuse for running out of storage capacity or power with this little jewel of a compact camera. I own professional digital camera equipment but often let this little guy handle the routine assignments.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jonathan Jackson

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: IF YOU WANT THE BEST... BUY THE BEST... THIS IS THE BEST...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff G.

customer_reviews.title: great camera and really a great quality photos but bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: great camera and really a great quality photos but bottom piece that covers battery fell off an company wont fix it..
customer_reviews.author: C. Lanois

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot A1100IS Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my wife who is not a "photographer," but just a "snap-shooter." The ease of use and picture quality are perfect for her, and for me, as well. The IS is very effective. It is much more than she expected, but not as intimidating as she worried it would be. Perfect for someone who wants to produce great, hassle-free images of family, friends, and the world.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Spadoni

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes awesome pictures, the zoom is great, and for the money is an excellent product. The one thing to be careful of is not to use it in extreeme cold. The inner lens gets foggy. It is fine once it warms back up. Great product though, unless you are ice fishing. :)
customer_reviews.author: Hiker Girl

customer_reviews.title: I loved it.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately after about 2 years I started having sensor issues with all the pictures turning purple and streaky. But until that point I loved this camera. Compact, tons of features, great options for different scene settings.
customer_reviews.author: Trimama

customer_reviews.title: Click Click
customer_reviews.text: I bought this like 3 years ago for my sisters birthday. She promptly lost the camera. I hope someone got some use out of it. I remember this being a cool little camera for in its day.
customer_reviews.author: Boris

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera gives you excellent pictures for a point and shoot. Easy to hold and zoom. I really like Canon, I have several of the A80's and A95's that when we had a problem with them Canon repaired them at no cost. You can't say enough for a company that stands behind their product like Canon does.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Miller

customer_reviews.title: Canon Camera
customer_reviews.text: For me the best part of this camera is the viewfinder. The LCD screen is great as long as you aren't outdoors in a sunny situation. I have missed too many pictures because I couldn't see the screen. With this camera I have the option of either one. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Dimarzio

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for a few years now... It works great. I'll stick with Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Mike  Pierzina

customer_reviews.title: review on canon powershot a1100is
customer_reviews.text: I like the picture quality, which is excellent for this point and shoot class camera. The first test of this camera was taking pictures of flowers (delia) at the Golden Gate Park in San Fancisco, including a sunny day and a cloudy day. For both days, almost all pictures are in focus. Flowers, leaves, and, yes, even honey bees all look so lively, sharp, and excellent color reproduction. I would highly recomment this camera to anyone who is looking for one in the point and shoot class.
customer_reviews.author: H. Y. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot 12.1 PM camera
customer_reviews.text: Very nice portable camera. Purchased for vacation overseas and I liked the fact that it took AA batteries, so I never had to worry about charging. Camera works very well. For a point and shoot I have no complaints about portability or image quality. The only thing I will say is the batteries do not last. I get around 50 pictures or so between needing to change batteries. I could not decide whether to go 3 star or 4 star but since my only complaint is battery life I give it a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful littel camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a gift for my wife. Her last camera had a little accident with the chair and 'died'. I chose this camera becuase of its size and color (she loves green). I have a larger Canon Powershot and I love it, but this camera comes in very handy for those quick shots around the house of our cats or our little nephew. It also comes in very handy when out on the town with the nephew and a smaller, more descrete camera is necessary so we don't look like the press. I recommend this little 'giant' to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Shimko

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money. Not the best for moving targets
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the money. It has decent battery life. My only beef is, it takes a while to snap the picture sometimes which if you have little kids of any kind of moving target might not be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied With The Canon A 1100 IS
customer_reviews.text: The size is good for me. I take it every where in my coat pocket. I have experience with technical features but wanted a simple point and shoot camera. The A 1100 IS as simple as it gets. However, it does have manual override features if I want to us them. I get great results with just point and shoot and that's all that I wanted. Photo's are sharp and crisp coming off my Canon printer. I am very satisfied with the color. I am really pleased with the purchase and do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this one !!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointd with this camera, being a canon and suposedly a 12 MP one, I had hoped that it would be a quality product, but the pictures I have been taking are very grainy, even when there is enough light, and when there isn't , well forget it ! I found that I could not zoom is at all as that made the quality unacceptable, I sent in some samples to Canon to show them what I meant, and they told that this was acceptable ! well, if that is acceptable, then don't bother with that camera !!
customer_reviews.author: happycamper

customer_reviews.title: Last of the viewfinders.
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was to replace an identical camera that crapped out (the telephoto control jammed the shutter button). The predecessor couldn't be repaired (it was still under warranty) and we insisted that Best Buy return our money, which they did. We like this camera because it is one of very few compact cameras remaining that still use a viewfinder in addition to the LCD screen. Other criteria included its use of AA batteries instead of expensive proprietary cells, and the use of SD memory cards that had fit in another Canon predecessor camera.
customer_reviews.author: D. Maass

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Camera in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: We had to replace a 5 year old Canon PowerShot after our 5 year old broke the old one. Looked at online reviews & consumer reports. Seemed to be the best bang for your buck. It is a great bang for your buck. The picture quality is very good - better than the older more expensive one. The only feature we don't have that we liked on the old camera is a quick shutter. It was good for capturing small children without having to wait for the shutter to catch up. The quality & size makes me not miss the feature much. GREAT BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Three Girls

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Liked this old camera I had in the past and decided to buy another one. Just as described by the seller and in very good condition. Everything works on the camera just as stated.
customer_reviews.author: JRad

customer_reviews.title: Solid Camera
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera in Afghanistan. It worked well. It was cheap enough for me to take it with me. Not sure if it's as good as some other cameras such as coolpix or whatever, but it was a lot cheaper when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: John Stedge

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was as advertised, but it's more "worn" than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my lady friend for Christmas, and it takes great pictures. She immediately purchased the photo printer which produces great pictures. I own a Powershot S3IS so because of it, I chose Canon. Would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: DonDor

customer_reviews.title: Fatal Error Alert
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera less than 8 months ago and at the time did not realize that this camera will produce a fatal error message, rendering this camera useless. The screen turns black and has script at the bottom telling you there is a "lens error. Restart camera". Canon denies this camera having this problem on many sites. The camera worked incredibly well up until this point, and would buy another one if I was guaranteed not to ever have this problem again.
customer_reviews.author: MLL

customer_reviews.title: Powershot Lens Error
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera in December 2009. By June 2010, camera lens would not open due to a lens error. It seems that this is a common error and it's too expensive to have fixed. There are many websites devoted to this error and how to diy fix. Unfortunately, the diy problems would not work. Most people have to purchase another camera. Having had Canon cameras for years and years, it is a disappointment that Canon would make a shoddy product and pass it on as high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joannie H

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera for years & it took great pictures. I recently upgraded to a new camera as the batteries just wouldn't last like they used to. I keep this as a spare though.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.R.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: We just took this camera on an extended trip abroad and were totally delighted with it. It made our old camera that we took along for backup look mediocre. Image stabilization is very good, exposure in low lighting was impressive, and automatic settings worked well to give us impressive photos. The only surprise was that there's no selection for image quality to control the size of the files.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Review of the Canon A1100IS Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: After only three months the lens would no longer open. I followed instructions from others on the internet who experienced the same problem. I could not get it open. The camera was like new. I only used it a few times. Never dropped it. Yes, the pictures were good but...a "throw away camera" after only three months!! Too expensive for that! The cost of sending it back for repair exceeded the value of the camera. Check this problem out online BEFORE you spend your money. I will not buy another Canon camera. They're junk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Remember the extra batteries
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and takes fine pictures. Be sure to take extra batteries. It eats through batteries pretty quick if you are going on vacation and taking hundreds of shots.
customer_reviews.author: grandmanana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use camera
customer_reviews.text: A very easy to use camera. You will be making excellent photographs in a few minutes. Almost as soon as you insert the batteries. The engineering for this camera is so well done. The balance is very good and it is easy to hold. The settings are also easy to apply. The cd that is included with the camera is an insert into the computer and it does the remainder type of installation. The cables packed with the camera are easy to use also. Within the first hour you will be taking photographs that you always wanted to do. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Norvelle Couch

customer_reviews.title: Camera worked for 1 day then quit.
customer_reviews.text: Received camera and was able to take pictures for one day before camera stopped working. Kept making a clicking sounds but would not take pictures. I think the clicking was the autofocus trying to focus. Replaced batteries still no luck. Was going to send back to Amazon for a replacement but they were sold out. Sent back to Amazon for full refund. Great service from Amazon. Went to WalMart and bought another one just like it and it has worked perfectly for past 2 months. Wife loved the style and model so we decided to give Canon another try.
customer_reviews.author: T. Layman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and takes great pictures. A good camera for the inexperienced photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cannon a1100
customer_reviews.text: As good as twice the price.. Crystal clear......I took a pic of an old black and white photo taken in 1930 and it came out better than the original. Even makes a 66 year old man (me) look good. I recommend even for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: David Youngblood

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my granddaughter's birthday and she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Arthur G. Washington

customer_reviews.title: Canon Camera
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very promptly, actually earlier than expected. Great price, excellent condition. Almost new. Happy to have found it as it had a view finder that new cameras do not have.
customer_reviews.author: Donna V.

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot 12.1 MP
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a timely manner. Easy to use. Takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: KodaColor

customer_reviews.title: My first digital camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, love the optical view-finder (which is one reason I bought it), turning off the LCD screen saves on batteries. In sunny conditions the screen is hard to see so the optical view-finder is almost necessary. I don't like the shutter delay. I'm accustomed to a film camera's instant shutter. I have taken about 30 photos, which all look good on a computer screen, have not yet printed any photos but at 12 MP those should print well, even printing larger size photos. For a less expensive model it is great.
customer_reviews.author: G. R. Janckila

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!  Perfect for a pocket or purse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my best friend as a Christmas gift and she couldn't be happier with it. The camera takes great pictures, is super easy to use, takes AA batteries so you can get them anywhere, sees really well in low light conditions and fits easily in her purse. In fact, her hubby just went on a trip and decided to take this camera with him instead of his Canon DSLR because it is just so easy, light and takes such good pics.
customer_reviews.author: Tisza Major

customer_reviews.title: camera review
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a gift. The camera seems to work very well and she is excited about the pictures she has taken. She is extremely pleased with this camera, and it arrived on time (before Christmas).
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last Long
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why they require more words on reviews? So I am waisting your time reading this as I am my waisting time doing them a FAVOR!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary M.

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It is easy to use, and takes beautiful pictures. The instructions are easy to understand, it's easy to operate and does a great job. I highly recommend this as a great camera that is user-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Levine

customer_reviews.title: the perfect camera
customer_reviews.text: this camera is the perfect size for carrying and the battery life is fantastic and the picture quality is just awesome for such a small camera
customer_reviews.author: ERIK LEVERINGTON

customer_reviews.title: Wicked Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The camera is WICKED AWESOME because there is no need to program it. You just point and shoot. Cool colors and easy to use. I received the camera as a gift and could not be happier with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Fein

customer_reviews.title: Great Pics
customer_reviews.text: We got this to take on vacation and were not disappointed. It takes great pictures and videos. With an 8gb card it takes almost endless videos and pictures. Downloading to my pc is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Canon powershot a1001s
customer_reviews.text: Great camera to carry everyday in my purse for those special family picture treasure shots that come up unexpectedly. I love the color and the ease of using the menu at a moments notice.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Fine little camera. I know it's highly rated by consumer reports. I have used it a little and it produces high quality photos. The IS is very welcome and close focusing is great. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Heath66

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This camera has great features and it is easy to use them. I have learned to use the auto setting with the flash off and for most situations with decent light (direct/indirect) the picture comes out very good. the flash does suck the life out of batteries. We traveled to the Grand Canyon took 500 pix with rechargeable batteries (once recharged)and now we have memories that will last a lifetime
customer_reviews.author: jhbolis

customer_reviews.title: Dying breed of Camera
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be the last of a dying breed of cameras with optical viewfinders. It takes great pictures when not zoomed. Zoom really needs a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Olney

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable weight and
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are simple to take even when not on automatic. Comfortable weight and size
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: canon powershot A1100IS
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use the camera easily with minimal practice including the zoom. The menus are easy to find and easy to understand. It weighs next to nothing but seems really sturdy. I've never felt confident about photography, but with this camera I'm looking forward to learning the more advanced features
customer_reviews.author: Wycliffe

customer_reviews.title: not great
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a little pocket camera, used to have a powershot S70 which was great but wanted a bigger screen and higher iso so I bought this and the picture quality is a little grainy. But the pictures do come out better than they look on the LCD! And having it on auto it doesn't always fire flash, the recharge is way too slow and the low battery icon comes on way to often!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Turner

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to fuss so this is great for my use. Just point and shoot and get great pictures. Small enough to to fit in a pocket but large enough to hold securely. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gull

customer_reviews.title: What a great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my wife earlier this year. She is using it constantly and it takes great pictures. Pro's: Takes great pictures, even in low light. Super detail. Con's: It takes about a second for the focus to settle, If you just mash the button, you get an out of focus picture. I'd still rate it as an excellent camera since most of the competition also has this usability flaw.
customer_reviews.author: DLM

customer_reviews.title: A Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace my Canon A1000IS which worked very well, but got lost at Mardi Gras. I can't get over the quality of the photos I have taken with this camera! I use this camera daily on the job to photograph structures and the fine detail is unbelievable. When I photograph welded joints at a distance over 10' and use the zoom my photos appear as if I am looking through a magnifying glass. Away from work photos I have taken are sharp and crisp looking.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Works good Takes great pictures Love the Zoom easy to load on computer Menu is easy to read and setup
customer_reviews.author: Don B

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: love this camera, had one a year ago but it was stolen so i was glad to find Amazon still had one available as they have been discontinued by Cannon for a newer model. Takes great pictures, very little shutter lag, battery life is good with Lithium batteries and it is very simple to operate. Only drawback to the camera is i wish it had a longer zoom.
customer_reviews.author: G. Winkleman

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great look and easy to use and take pictures with. I love it, no complaints from me. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Nilutz6

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - good little camera
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about you...but when I'm on vacation or at a party, I actually want to be in the moment, and not fussing around with complicated photography equipment simply so I can impress my friends with how much I spent. This Canon PowerShot camer really fills the bill. It takes good picutres, with ease of use and is small enough to take with you on any vacation with no hassle at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Shopsalot

customer_reviews.title: great little camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: takes just the right pictures for the price. I use the camera for when I need a camera that I can afford to damage/loose (on water, etc). It takes great still pictures and acceptable moving ones if you set it up right
customer_reviews.author: Greg-o

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot A1100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Silver) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverFROM THE MANUFACTURER


There’s nothing more satisfying than taking great pictures! And with the Canon PowerShot A1100 IS it’s so effortless. The 12.1-megapixel resolution and 4x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer ensure radiant, detailed images. Plus, you’ve got an advanced DIGIC 4 Image Processor with evolved Face Detection Technology and the Face Detection Self-Timer for extraordinary control and performance. Smart AUTO lets you handle challenging conditions with ease. 

PowerShot A1100 IS Highlights 



12.1-megapixel resolution, 4x optical zoom and Optical Image Stabilizer
With the PowerShot A1100 IS, dramatic, personal pictures have never been easier to shoot and share. This 12.1-megapixel digital camera lets you create impressive large photos of family and friends you’ll be proud to display. The high-resolution images taken by the PowerShot A1100 IS can be enlarged up to 13 x 19 inches. 

The PowerShot A1100 IS has a 4x optical zoom lens that makes it easy to get the inspiring, emotive close-ups that will make your images lasting keepsakes. This magnificent lens gives you the power to shoot distant subjects with razor-sharp precision and stunning lifelike color. So you can brilliantly capture a closer shot of a landscape, or a child’s big smile. 

The PowerShot A1100 IS is equipped with Canon’s acclaimed Optical Image Stabilizer Technology that automatically detects and corrects camera shake--one of the leading causes of fuzzy or blurred shots. Even when zoomed in, you can get the steady, crisp, brilliant images you’ll be proud to shoot and share. And Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer Technology is so convenient to use. It functions perfectly with or without a flash. 

A World of Advantages with Canon’s Technology 

The DIGIC 4 Image Processor has evolved Face Detection Technology that tracks the faces of moving subjects and lets the shooter enter the frame seamlessly with the Face Detection Self-Timer. 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor
Canon’s most advanced image processor, DIGIC 4, delivers evolved Face Detection Technology that keeps every face in every photo looking its very best. The technology finds and tracks the faces of moving subjects until you’re ready to shoot, then delivers perfect focus. In addition, exposure, flash and white balance are compensated, so that faces exhibit natural skin tones and backgrounds are properly exposed. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the advanced DIGIC 4 Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

A Face Detection Self-Timer automatically detects an increase in the number of faces and makes the appropriate adjustments. For instance, to include the photographer’s face in a group shot, there’s no need to rush in. Just put the camera on a stand or tripod, specify Face Detection Self-Timer, and the camera will wait for the photographer’s face to get on-camera before it takes the shot. Motion Detection tracks moving subjects in a much larger range--allowing you to wait for the perfect shot without refocusing. 

Intelligent Contrast Correction
DIGIC 4 also makes possible the i-Contrast (Intelligent Contrast Correction) system, which controls the compensation level in pixel units to brighten dark areas while leaving bright areas unchanged for better images where the main subject is dark, and more natural transition. The PowerShot A1100 IS can even use i-Contrast in playback mode to adjust images that were shot without the setting activated. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures. 1) Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken. 2) The PowerShot A1100 IS can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback. 3) You can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

Life doesn’t give you second chances to capture special times. That’s why the PowerShot A1100 IS features an ISO 1600 setting that reduces the effects of camera shake and sharpens subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. ISO can be expanded to 3200 when you select ISO 3200 Special Scene mode. 

Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper settings
Just set the Canon PowerShot A1100 IS to Smart AUTO and you’re ready for maximum enjoyment from your picture taking every time. It’s a relaxing and satisfying way to shoot because you can completely concentrate on your subject knowing that the camera has the technical details covered. Advanced Canon technology intelligently analyzes your situation and shooting conditions. Then it automatically selects an appropriate setting from 18 specially defined settings. So whether you’re photographing flowers, a captivating sunset, or your friends at the park, you can be confident that you’re getting dramatic, memorable images. 

Shooting Modes
Advanced presets for the best possible photos under certain conditions. With 18 Shooting Modes including 9 Special Scene Modes, you’re ready for whatever shot comes your way 

Large, high-quality 2.5-inch LCD
The PowerShot A1100 IS’s 2.5-inch LCD screen gives you the big picture, whether you’re shooting, reviewing or showing off your images. This high-resolution screen offers a crisp, clear and bright picture. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light. 

Uses 2 AA-size batteries
Conveniently, you don’t need to worry about running out or recharging of batteries. Since AA-size batteries can be purchased at any store, simply get new ones locally. 

The Complete Print Solution 

Print/Share Button for easy direct printing and downloading, plus ID Photo Print and Movie Print with select PIXMA Inkjet Photo Printers and SELPHY Compact Photo Printers. 

The PowerShot A1100 IS’s Print/Share button makes direct printing easier than ever. Simply connect the PowerShot A1100 IS to a Canon PIXMA Inkjet Photo Printer or SELPHY Compact Photo Printer or any PictBridge compatible photo printer, press the lighted Print/Share button and print! Also use the Print/Share button to transfer images to a computer (Windows and Macintosh). 

Print your own ID photos in up to 28 different sizes or use the Movie Print function to output multiple stills from a recorded movie on a single sheet with a Canon SELPHY Compact Photo Printer. 

What's in the Box

 * PowerShot A1100 IS body 
 * AA-size alkaline battery (x2) 
 * 128 MB SD memory card (SDC-128MB) 
 * Wrist strap (WS-800) 
 * Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM 
 * USB interface cable (IFC-400PCU) 
 * AV cable (AVC-DC400)
feature_bullets: 12.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality poster-size prints
4x optical zoom and Optical Image Stabilizer; 2.5-inch LCD screen
DIGIC 4 Image Processor with evolved Face Detection Technology; Face Detection Self-timer
Compatible with SD/SDHC, MMC/MMC Plus/HC MMC Plus (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars453 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
